Small works well for 145 lb, 5'5" or you could size up for a less fitted look. You would also need to size up if you're taller so the sleeves are long enough. The burgundy color seemed true to the listing (my photo makes it look a bit more orange/brown than it is) and the texture of the pattern is a nice touch. Just a heads up, the main product photo doesn't really communicate that the sleeves and skirt are sheer and the slip is just above knee length. I have a bit of a tummy but the cut of the fabric is still flattering. Sleeves were not too poofy for my liking like a lot of sleeves are.

I ordered the bright blue in medium and it’s lovely and well designed . It’s a little hard to pull over the head if you’re busty so I suggest stepping into it then pulling it up over the hips. Why I ordered it is because I have been missing the natural waistline in dresses for years now and finally found a dress that has a waist for an hourglass figure - no more empire waist which doesn’t suit anyone busty as the false waist often intrudes on the chest and doesn’t highlight the natural hour glass figure. I hope to order other colors and am happy with the elegant and ladylike look of this . Also, long sleeves are beautiful and just what my dermatologist suggested since I’ve had skin cancer and can’t show arms in the hot summer sun ! Covers up nicely and delicately, this is perfect !
I truly recommend you!

But I’m looking forward to wearing it in the cool fall weather!
